alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 1:48PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding due to moderate to heavy rainfall will continue. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara counties, including the Alisal burn scar. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near the Alisal burn scar. Minor flooding of roadways and small streams will continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain across San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara counties. Roadway flooding has already been observed in the advisory area. Many areas in San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara counties have already seen between 1.00 and 3.00 inches. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.50 inches per hour have been observed across the advisory area, with local rates up to 0.60 inches per hour in Arroyo Grande. There is still the threat of rainfall rates increasing up to 0.75 inches per hour or locally higher. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Santa Maria, Santa Barbara, San Luis Obispo, Lompoc, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Santa Ynez, Point Conception, Montecito, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Carpinteria, Cambria, Solvang, Vandenberg Air Force Base, Orcutt, Los Alamos and the Alisal burn scar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be prepared to shelter in place if you encounter debris flow activity. Do not attempt to cross flooded roadways. The rain could trigger shallow mud and debris flows across the Alisal burn scar, as well as minor rockslides and roadway flooding.
